channel.title: P128 — tiny reviews of tiny games

item.title: MAZE DOG
item.description:
FIND THE CHICKS! DIG FOR SNACKS! ANNOY THE DUCKS! NAVIGATE THE MAZE!

MAZE DOG is a cute little adventure game for 1 player, sporting a seriously rad theme tune and a simple yet fun aesthetic! You go from screen to screen controlling a cute little puppy. You need to find 8 chickens that has run away from their home and theres’ 8 “snacks” hidden throughout the game for completionists. Going from screen to screen can be a little dull sometimes, but finding a chick does feel rewarding. Plus there are a bunch of little details that I enjoy, like pushing bulldogs into puddles or going to the beach to bark at ducks (don’t do it!).

Try MAZE DOG with a steamy cup of java this afternoon.

item.title: Plan Bee
item.description:
In Plan Bee you play as a “bee”. A bee is a type of flying insect that plays a super important part of the eco-system. It “pollinates” the flowers by taking “pollen” from one flower to another, helping the flowers create new flowers, ensuring eco-diversity. It is your job as a player to navigate from flower to flower, collecting the pollen. But your bee is dizzy and starving, probably from colony collapse disorder, and will die soon should you fail to find new pollen in time or collapse to the ground!

Plan Bee is a fun little 5 minute high-score single player game, sorta like Flappy Bird.
